        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.7d2f032a:
import aiml
k = aiml.Kernel()
k.learn("../input/aiml-files/standard/std-german.aiml")
k.respond("LOAD AIML B")
while True:
    k.respond(input("EIN ROBOTER"))
source.bf6c1367:
import aiml

# The Kernel object is the public interface to
# the AIML interpreter.
k = aiml.Kernel()

# Use the 'learn' method to load the contents
# of an AIML file into the Kernel.
k.learn("std-startup.xml")

# Use the 'respond' method to compute the response
# to a user's input string.  respond() returns
# the interpreter's response, which in this case
# we ignore.
k.respond("load aiml b")

# Loop forever, reading user input from the command
# line and printing responses.
while True:    
        print k.respond(raw_input("Warum benutzt Du solche Worte?")

source.cf7fd014:
#Python-aiml

Python-aiml implements an interpreter for AIML, the Artificial Intelligence Markup Language developed by Dr. Richard Wallace of the A.L.I.C.E. Foundation. It can be used to implement a conversational AI program.

Forked from PyAIML 0.8.6 (https://github.com/cdwfs/pyaiml) PyAIML (c) Cort Stratton
https://pypi.org/project/python-aiml/
